qas.question: What is partially credited for the significant boost in sales of Macs in recent years?

answers.text: the success of the iPod and the iPhone

qas.question: What allows users to easily sync data between an iPhone and a Mac?
What consumer trend has hurt many personal computer manufacturers?
Which smartphone has hurt personal computer manufacterers the most?
What are the top two computing devices consumers are choosing?

plausible_answers.text: the success of the iPod and the iPhone

qas.question: What is partially credited for the insignificant boost in sales of Macs in recent years?
What allows users to easily sync data between an iPhone and a PC?
What consumer trend has hurt many business computer manufacturers?
Which smartphone has hurt personal computer manufacterers the least?
What are the top three computing devices consumers are choosing?

context: In recent years, Apple has seen a significant boost in sales of Macs. This has been attributed, in part, to <a0_0><b5_0>the success of the iPod and the iPhone<b5_0/><a0_0/>, a halo effect whereby satisfied iPod or iPhone owners purchase more Apple products, and Apple has since capitalized on that with the <a1_0><b6_0>iCloud cloud service<b6_0/><a1_0/> that allows users to seamlessly sync data between these devices and Macs. Nonetheless, like other personal computer manufacturers, the Macintosh lines have been hurt by consumer trend towards <a2_0><b7_0>smartphones and tablet computers<b7_0/><a2_0/> (particularly <a3_0><b8_0>Apple's own <a4_0><b9_0>iPhone<b8_0/><a3_0/> and iPad<b9_0/><a4_0/>, respectively) as the computing devices of choice among consumers.
